Package controller

Class MapController

java.lang.Object
controller.MapController
public class MapController
extends java.lang.Object
Controller class for handling map data.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    MapController​(GameEngine p_gameEngine)
    Create a new map controller with the specified GameEngine.

  • Constructor Details

    • MapController

      public MapController​(GameEngine p_gameEngine)
      Create a new map controller with the specified GameEngine.
      Parameters:
      p_gameEngine - A GameEngine object which is populated with the map data.

  • Method Details

    • loadMapData

      public boolean loadMapData​(java.lang.String p_fileName, boolean p_createNewFile, boolean p_allowInvalid)
      Load the map contents into the game.
      Parameters:
      p_fileName - The complete path of the file.
      p_createNewFile - Used to indicate if a new map need to be created if file is not present.
      p_allowInvalid - Used to indicate if invalid map is allowed to load.
      Returns:
      true if map was loaded successfully else it returns false

    • loadMapContinentsFromFile

      public int loadMapContinentsFromFile​(int p_idx, java.util.List<java.lang.String> p_lines)
      Load the continents from map file.
      Parameters:
      p_idx - Index of the current line.
      p_lines - List of all the lines in the map file.
      Returns:
      current index.

    • loadMapCountriesFromFile

      public int loadMapCountriesFromFile​(int p_idx, java.util.List<java.lang.String> p_lines)
      Load the countries from map file.
      Parameters:
      p_idx - Index of the current line
      p_lines - List of all the lines in the map file.
      Returns:
      current index

    • loadMapBordersFromFile

      public int loadMapBordersFromFile​(int p_idx, java.util.List<java.lang.String> p_lines)
      Load the borders from map file.
      Parameters:
      p_idx - Index of the current line
      p_lines - List of all the lines in the map file.
      Returns:
      current index

    • checkSameBlock

      public boolean checkSameBlock​(int p_idx, java.util.List<java.lang.String> p_lines)
      Checks whether the given line is a part of an existing block in the map file. The check is based on the fact that the lines in a block are not blank and contain at least 1 space.
      Parameters:
      p_idx - Index of the current line.
      p_lines - List of all the lines in the map.
      Returns:
      Boolean indicating whether the current line is a part of the existing block.

    • getCountryById

      public CountryModel getCountryById​(java.lang.String p_id)
      Helper method for retrieving the CountryModel object from countryId which is the countryName.
      Parameters:
      p_id - Name of the country.
      Returns:
      Country.

    • getContinentById

      public ContinentModel getContinentById​(java.lang.String p_id)
      Helper method for retrieving the ContinentModel object from continentId which is the name.
      Parameters:
      p_id - Name of the continent.
      Returns:
      Continent object.

    • editContinent

      public void editContinent​(java.lang.String[] p_commandParameters)
      editContinent takes in relevant commandParameters and calls the associated methods which are addContinent and removeContinent.
      Parameters:
      p_commandParameters - List of command parameter.

    • addContinent

      public void addContinent​(java.lang.String p_continentId, int p_continentValue)
      addContinent adds valid continents to the map. A continent may not be added if it already exists in the gameEngine.
      Parameters:
      p_continentId - Name of the continent.
      p_continentValue - The army value of the continent.

    • removeCountry

      public void removeCountry​(java.lang.String p_countryId)
      Remove a country from the map using the countryId which is countryName.
      Parameters:
      p_countryId - Name of the country to be removed.

    • removeBorder

      public void removeBorder​(int p_countryPosition)
      Remove the border associated with the given position. A new border matrix is created which does not include the country for which the border is to be removed.
      Parameters:
      p_countryPosition - position of the country (in the country list) for which the border is to be removed.

    • editCountry

      public void editCountry​(java.lang.String[] p_commandParameters)
      editCountry takes in relevant commandParameters and calls the associated methods which are addCountry and removeCountry.
      Parameters:
      p_commandParameters - List of command parameter.

    • addCountry

      public void addCountry​(java.lang.String p_countryId, java.lang.String p_continentId)
      Add a new country to the map using Country name and the continent name.
      Parameters:
      p_countryId - Name of the country.
      p_continentId - Name of the continent.

    • allocateSpaceNewCountry

      public void allocateSpaceNewCountry​(java.lang.String p_countryId, ContinentModel p_parentContinent)
      Helper function to create a new country. It creates a new country, updates the border graph, and adds the country to the list of countries and the parent continent.
      Parameters:
      p_countryId - Name of the country to be created.
      p_parentContinent - Continent to which the country is to be added.

    • editNeighbor

      public void editNeighbor​(java.lang.String[] p_commandParameters)
      editNeighbor takes in relevant commandParameters and calls the associated methods which are addNeighbor and removeNeighbor.
      Parameters:
      p_commandParameters - List of command parameter.

    • addNeighbor

      public void addNeighbor​(java.lang.String p_countryId, java.lang.String p_neighborId)
      Add a border between the give countries.
      Parameters:
      p_countryId - Name of the country.
      p_neighborId - Name of the neighbor country.

    • removeNeighbor

      public void removeNeighbor​(java.lang.String p_countryId, java.lang.String p_neighborId)
      Remove the border between the given countries.
      Parameters:
      p_countryId - Name of the Country.
      p_neighborId - Name of the neighbor country.

    • showMap

      public void showMap()
      Display the contents of the map.

    • showMapForGamePlay

      public void showMapForGamePlay()
      Display the contents of the map along with assignment of player and count of armies in each countries.

    • saveMap

      public boolean saveMap​(java.lang.String fileName)
      Write the map to file.
      Parameters:
      fileName - Filename to which the map is to be written.
      Returns:
      true if map was saved successful else returns false

    • isMapValid

      public boolean isMapValid()
      A helper method to validate the map
      Returns:
      true if the map is valid, false if not valid

    • saveContinents

      public void saveContinents​(java.io.FileWriter p_writer) throws java.io.IOException
      Write the Continent data in the map file.
      Parameters:
      p_writer - FileWriter object.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Input-output related exceptions while writing to file.

    • saveCountries

      public void saveCountries​(java.io.FileWriter p_writer) throws java.io.IOException
      Write Country data in the map file.
      Parameters:
      p_writer - FileWriter object.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Input-output related exceptions while writing to file.

    • saveBorders

      public void saveBorders​(java.io.FileWriter p_writer) throws java.io.IOException
      Write border data in the map file.
      Parameters:
      p_writer - FileWriter object.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Input-output related exceptions while writing to file.

    • getNeighbors

      public java.util.ArrayList<CountryModel> getNeighbors​(CountryModel p_country)
      Get the list of neighboring countries of the given country.
      Parameters:
      p_country - The country object for which we need to get the neighbors
      Returns:
      A list of countries which may be empty.

    • readMap

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> readMap​(java.lang.String l_fileName) throws java.io.IOException
      A utility method to read the contents from file.
      Parameters:
      l_fileName - The complete path of the file.
      Returns:
      A List of all the lines in the file.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Exception while reading the map file.

    • validateMap

      public boolean validateMap()
      Validates Map Data
      • Checks if there are any Duplicate Continents
      • Checks if there are any Duplicate Countries
      • Checks if the borders are defined in the map or not
      • Checks if the map is a connected graph
      • Checks if each continent as itself is a connected graph
      Returns:
      true if the map is valid

    • validateCountries

      public boolean validateCountries​(java.util.ArrayList<CountryModel> p_listOfCountries)
      Checks whether the map contains at least one country and if there are any duplicate countries
      Parameters:
      p_listOfCountries - The list of countries defined in the map
      Returns:
      a boolean to convey whether the map has valid number of countries or not

    • validateContinents

      public boolean validateContinents​(java.util.ArrayList<ContinentModel> p_listOfContinents)
      Checks whether the map contains at least one country and if there are any duplicate continents
      Parameters:
      p_listOfContinents - the complete list of continents defined in the map
      Returns:
      a boolean to convey whether the map has valid number of continents or not

    • isEmptyContinent

      public boolean isEmptyContinent​(java.util.ArrayList<ContinentModel> p_listOfContinents)
      Checks whether any of the continents is empty.
      Parameters:
      p_listOfContinents - the complete list of continents defined in the map
      Returns:
      true if any of the continent is empty, false if all continents have at least one country in them

    • hasDuplicates

      public boolean hasDuplicates​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> p_mapData)
      Checks if the given array list has duplicates
      Parameters:
      p_mapData - a array list of strings in which duplicates has to be identified
      Returns:
      a boolean specifying whether the given array has duplicates or not

    • validateBorders

      public boolean validateBorders​(int[][] p_borderGraph)
      Check to see if borders are defined in the map
      Parameters:
      p_borderGraph - a association graph specifying the connection between the countries
      Returns:
      a boolean specifying whether borders are defined or not

    • validateGraph

      public boolean validateGraph​(int[][] p_adjacencyMatrix, int p_source, boolean isSubGraph)
      Checks whether the graph is connected or not
      Parameters:
      p_adjacencyMatrix - A two dimensional array representation of a graph
      p_source - The node or position in matrix for which we need to check adjacency for
      isSubGraph - true or false based on what kind of graph the method should validate
      Returns:
      a boolean based on whether the graph is connected or not

    • isCountryAConnectedGraph

      public boolean isCountryAConnectedGraph​(java.util.ArrayList<ContinentModel> p_listOfContinents, java.util.ArrayList<CountryModel> p_listOfCountries, int[][] p_graph)
      To check if all the countries in a continent form a connected graph among themselves
      Parameters:
      p_listOfContinents - The list of countries defined in the map
      p_listOfCountries - The complete list of continents defined in the map
      p_graph - a association graph specifying the connection between the countries
      Returns:
      true if map is connected graph else it returns false
